content.en: HIV Algorithm Advancements: Researchers are investigating the use of algorithms in various aspects of HIV testing and diagnosis in order to improve outcomes for pregnant women and infants. These algorithms include rapid HIV testing, acute HIV infection detection, early infant diagnosis programs, clinical parameters, multiassay algorithms, nonvirologic algorithms, HIV DNA PCR testing, HIV diagnosis algorithms, HIV testing at birth, HIV rapid tests, point-of-care birth HIV testing, point-of-care nucleic acid tests, and the GeneXpert HIV-1 qualitative assay. By utilizing these algorithms, researchers hope to increase the proportion of pregnant women obtaining HIV results, improve the uptake of perinatal HIV interventions, and achieve early diagnosis of HIV infection in infants.
content.da: Fremskridt inden for HIV-algoritmer: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer i forskellige aspekter af HIV-testning og -diagnose for at forbedre resultaterne for gravide kvinder og spædbørn. Disse algoritmer inkluderer hurtige HIV-tests, påvisning af akut HIV-infektion, tidlige diagnoseprogrammer for spædbørn, kliniske parametre, multiassay-algoritmer, ikke-virologiske algoritmer, HIV DNA PCR-testning, HIV-diagnosealgoritmer, HIV-testning ved fødslen, hurtige HIV-tests, point-of-care fødsels-HIV-testning, point-of-care nukleinsyre-tests og GeneXpert HIV-1 kvalitativ assay. Ved at anvende disse algoritmer håber forskerne at øge andelen af gravide kvinder, der får HIV-resultater, forbedre modtagelsen af perinatale HIV-interventioner samt opnå tidlig diagnose af HIV-infektion hos spædbørn.
